Attached is the Original Licensing Study Report for the above referenced facility. Due to
the established violations, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, an original license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.

Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The Michigan Youth Treatment Center (MYTC) will be a program operating inside
of and separately from the Macomb County Juvenile Justice Center. This 60-bed
secure facility will be located on the first and third floor of this building. Upon
arrival to the facility there is a large parking lot where the front entrance to the
Macomb County JJC can be seen. The entrance to the MYTC is located to the
right of the entrance to the Macomb facility, facing west. Upon entering the facility
there are several offices and administrative spaces and this eventually leads to a
hallway that moves east towards the units. There are two units on the first floor
with ten beds each located in the south end of the building. Across from these
units are two classrooms. Moving further to the west side of the building allows
2

access to a gymnasium and an outside recreational space. Moving back east
through a hallway allows for access to an additional five classroom spaces. Here
a commons area and large cafeteria space is available. A full kitchen is located to
the east behind the cafeteria. Continuing east back toward the front entrance of
the building there is a medical wing as well as a boiler room. The main stairwell to
be used leaves the first floor of the building and provides access to the second
floor. This floor contains classroom and office space that will be utilized by the
program. The same stairwell provides access to the third floor which is where the
sleeping units are located. There are four identical units located on this floor.
There is a doorway connecting the mezzanine level top floor bedrooms for each
pair of units. Each unit has a row of five bedrooms with a mezzanine style floor
above it containing five more bedrooms. The bedrooms contain adequate space,
toilets and faucets for the use of youth. Each unit has a control room for the use of
staff, as well as office and custodial space. All doors at the facility are secure and
are under locking systems. There is elevator access on the same floor as the
units however will not be utilized by MYTC staff or youth at this time as the
elevator exits on the main floor of the facility to the Macomb County Juvenile
Justice side of the building. There is a separate stairwell located past the units on
the third floor that provides egress for both the second and third floors to exit the
building on the first floor.
Within the secure building are four separate outdoor spaces for the use of
recreation of the youth, as well as a gymnasium space inside the building. The
section of the building being operated by MYTC has seven classroom spaces to
meet the educational needs of youth.
An Environmental Health Inspection was approved as of 5/27/25 resulting in an
“A” rating. The City of Mount Clemens approved this property to be used in this
capacity as of 08/15/2023. The facility does have working cameras in multiple
locations, and these have the ability to record and save video.
B. Program Description
Michigan Youth Treatment Center (MYTC) is a secure program designed to
provide a safe, secure, strength-based treatment and support for 60 males ages
12-20 years of age who have a history of delinquent behaviors, mental health
issues, and trauma needs. The program offers youth a full range of therapeutic,
education, support, and recreational services to assist them in the transition back
to the community. Youth may be referred by Juvenile Justice Assignment Unit,
Care Managed Organizations, or through a court order. The staff-to-resident ratio
will be 1:4 during waking hours and 1:8 during sleeping hours.
MYTC is designed to provide behavioral health services through Cognitive
Behavioral Treatment modalities used in individual, family, and group therapy
settings. Each youth will have a treatment plan with specified outcomes that is
related to their individualized needs and targeted discharge placement. MYTC will
utilize a positive behavior support system that will include listening, observing
3

behavior cues, and responding with de-escalation techniques to foster a safe and
supportive environment for youth. MYTC staff will be trained in the use of MANDT
for de-escalation and restraint. The behavior support system includes a level
system for rewarding positive behaviors, and fair consistent consequences to
decrease negative behaviors. MYTC will provide year-round educational
programming that meets each youth different learning styles and prepares them
for high school graduation, career, entry, and postsecondary education. MYTC will
provide medical, dental, and psychiatric care to youth.

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Due to established rule violations, a written corrective action plan is required. Upon
approval of the corrective action plan, a six-month original license is recommended.
